pulltitle: Enabling relay_log_purge
pullsbody:
so that MySQL purges old relay bin logs saving disk space.

We had 36GB of `mysqld-relay-bin.*` logs that were removed when this option was enabled (which had been filling our 50GB disks).

I want to get the db teams input on this.
pull_repo_desc: Tools and Chef cookbooks used by Mozilla Services Operations to provision and manage Persona
pull_commit_message: Enabling relay_log_purge so that MySQL purges old relay bin logs saving disk space

pulltitle: Enforce Server Defined Cipher Order, bringing AWS ELB policy in line
pullsbody:
with best practices given for, e.g. Apache:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS#Apache
SSLHonorCipherOrder     on

Add "Server-Defined-Cipher-Order": True
Increment version in policy_name
pull_repo_desc: Tools and Chef cookbooks used by Mozilla Services Operations to provision and manage Persona
pull_commit_message:
Enforce Server Defined Cipher Order, bringing AWS ELB policy in line
with best practices given for, e.g. Apache:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS#Apache
SSLHonorCipherOrder     on

Add "Server-Defined-Cipher-Order": True
Increment version in policy_name

pulltitle: Enforce Server Defined Cipher Order, bringing AWS ELB policy in line
pullsbody:
with best practices given for, e.g. Apache:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS#Apache

Add "Server-Defined-Cipher-Order": True
Increment version in policy_name

pulltitle: raise toobusy maximum_event_loop_lag to 1000ms
pullsbody:
With respect to https://github.com/mozilla/persona/issues/4039 and https://github.com/mozilla/persona/issues/4027, we want to raise this threshold since tossing spurious errors back at users at low request volume isnt' useful.

/cc @gene1wood
pull_repo_desc: Tools and Chef cookbooks used by Mozilla Services Operations to provision and manage Persona
pull_commit_message: raise toobusy maximum_event_loop_lag to 1000ms

pulltitle: change deployment types and number to support an estimated target of 2.5m ADU
pullsbody:
Methodology was to take this post: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!searchin/mozilla.dev.identity/ADU$20load/mozilla.dev.identity/st_eL7kUpUw/hrOUUatl5i0J

I.E. at 3M ADU we run 4.41 load on 2.3Ghz 24 core procs - suggesting we need about 14 processors with 2.5 compute units each to hit 3m in amazon.

thoughts?
pull_repo_desc: Tools and Chef cookbooks used by Mozilla Services Operations to provision and manage Persona
pull_commit_message: change deployment types and number to support an estimated target of 2.5m ADU
